item.title: Sheikh Hasina extradition: Bangladesh sends note verbale asking India to send back deposed PM - The Hindu
item.description:
Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Deposed PM Sheikh Hasina from India

Published: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Bangladesh's interim government has requested the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India, where she has been living in exile since fleeing the country amid protests.

  • Sheikh Hasina fled to India on August 5, 2024, amid student-led protests that deposed her.
  • Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has issued arrest warrants against Hasina for crimes against humanity.
  • The interim government has sent a diplomatic note to India requesting her return for judicial proceedings.
  • An existing extradition treaty between Bangladesh and India could facilitate the process.
“Bangladesh wants her back here for the judicial process,” Foreign Affairs Adviser Touhid Hossain said.

In conclusion, Bangladesh is actively pursuing the legal return of Sheikh Hasina to face serious charges stemming from her time in office.

item.title: Protests in J&K over reservation policy, CM Omar Abdullah's son joins stir | What we know - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Protests in J&K Over Reservation Policy, CM Omar Abdullah's Son Joins Stir

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

Several political leaders and hundreds of students have gathered outside the residence of Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah to seek a review of the reservation policy, introduced by the administration earlier this year.

  • Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's son joined the protests alongside students and party members.
  • Opposition leaders have also expressed their dissent regarding the new reservation policy.
  • The Jammu and Kashmir government formed a panel to review the policy amid growing calls for its revision.
“We hope the govt that came to power with a huge mandate and with a promise that they will rationalise the reservation - we hope the NC govt fulfils their promises in a time-bound manner.” - Iltija Mufti

The growing unrest over the reservation policy highlights significant political and social tensions within Jammu and Kashmir, particularly concerning youth representation and equitable access to opportunities.

item.title: Alarming that Kerala's waste was dumped in Tamil Nadu: Kerala High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Kerala High Court Condemns Waste Dumping in Tamil Nadu

Published on: 23 Dec 2024, 9:56 am

The Kerala High Court criticized the state government for inadequate waste management, highlighting illegal dumping of biomedical waste in Tamil Nadu.

  • The court described the situation as alarming and required a report by January 10, 2025.
  • The Cochin Corporation must address polluted drains and dumping prevention measures.
  • Details are required regarding waste disposal from hospitals and collection practices.
  • Six criminal cases have been filed with three arrests made.
  • Additionally, a food poisoning incident at an Anganwadi was flagged, with concerns over contaminated water used for food preparation.
"It is an alarming situation that waste generated in Kerala is being disposed in the neighbouring State, that too in a haphazard manner and contrary to the legal requirements." - Kerala High Court

The court's decisions stem from a broader investigation into waste management following a significant incident at the Brahmapuram garbage yard, pointing to systemic issues that require urgent attention.

item.title: Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks - ThePrint
item.description:
Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks

Date: Recent
Source: ThePrint

In a swift decision, Jayant Chaudhary, leader of the Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD), has removed all national and state spokespersons following remarks made by Dalit leader Kamal Gautam, who criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments about Ambedkar.

  • All RLD national and state spokespersons were dismissed for being either inactive or overly active.
  • The decision followed Gautam's call for Shah to apologize for his 'inappropriate' remarks on Ambedkar.
  • Shah asserted his statements were misrepresented and defended his remarks in the Rajya Sabha.
  • Gautam highlighted the lack of action against rising criminal incidents affecting Dalits and women.
  • The removal may indicate internal party tensions regarding public comments and coalition dynamics.
“Amit Shah’s statement on Babasaheb is not correct... This will reach all those who follow Babasaheb across the world.” - Kamal Gautam

This incident underscores the sensitivity surrounding Dalit issues within Indian politics and the reaction of political parties to internal dissent.

item.title: Delhi High Court refuses anticipatory bail to Puja Khedkar in UPSC cheating case - The Tribune India
item.description:
Delhi High Court Denies Bail to Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

Date: Recent Source: The Tribune

The Delhi High Court has refused anticipatory bail to former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar, who is facing allegations of cheating and misusing reservation benefits in the UPSC Civil Services Examination.

  • The court ruled that there is a strong prima facie case against Khedkar, requiring further investigation.
  • Khedkar is accused of fraudulently misrepresenting information on her application to obtain OBC and disability quota benefits.
  • The judge described the case as a significant fraud against a constitutional body and society.
  • The Delhi Police and the UPSC opposed Khedkar's bail plea during the hearing.
  • Khedkar has denied all allegations against her.
The judge stated, “It was a classic case of fraud committed on a constitutional body as well as on society.”

This case highlights ongoing scrutiny regarding exam integrity and the use of reservation systems in civil services.

item.title: "Intention To Dupe UPSC": Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Denied Pre-Arrest Bail - NDTV
item.description:
Intention To Dupe UPSC: Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Denied Pre-Arrest Bail

Date: July 31, 2024 Source: NDTV

The Delhi High Court has denied anticipatory bail to former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar, who faces charges of forgery and cheating related to her exam claims.

  • The court observed Khedkar's actions were intended to deceive authorities as part of a larger conspiracy.
  • Charges against her include forging documents and claiming benefits meant for disadvantaged groups.
  • The investigation has implications for possible collusion involving government officials.
  • Khedkar argues her physical disability claims were valid, but the court found her unfit for appointment.
  • Her bail plea had been opposed by both Delhi Police and UPSC, emphasizing the need for investigation into a wider fraud.
“Her steps (were) part of a larger conspiracy... the investigation reveals the petitioner is not a fit candidate to avail benefits meant for disadvantaged groups.”

This case has garnered significant media attention and raises questions about integrity within the civil service selection process.

item.title: Ex IAS Trainee Officer Puja Khedkar Denied Pre-Arrest Bail In UPSC Case - NDTV

item.title: Suspected Khalistani terrorists killed in UP encounter had ISI backing, carried AK-47s | What we know - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Suspected Khalistani terrorists killed in UP encounter had ISI backing, carried AK-47s

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: HT News Desk

The Uttar Pradesh and Punjab police eliminated three suspected Khalistani terrorists in a collaborative operation. These individuals were reportedly backed by Pakistan's ISI.

  • The terrorists were connected to the Khalistan Zindabad Force and were implicated in a grenade attack in Gurdaspur.
  • The operation was praised by Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav as a “major breakthrough” against ISI-sponsored terrorism.
  • Investigations revealed involvement from a UK-based mastermind with ties to the British Army.
  • Authorities are continuing to investigate the module to uncover additional members and connections.
"Jagjit Singh is reported to be working in the British Army as well." - DGP Gaurav Yadav

The joint operation signifies the effectiveness of interstate collaboration in combatting terrorism.

item.title: "Chance At Centre...": Ajit Pawar's 1st Reaction To NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal Row - NDTV

item.title: Delhi polls: BJP releases 'Aarop Patra' against AAP government; Kejriwal reacts - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi polls: BJP releases 'Aarop Patra' against AAP government; Kejriwal reacts

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The BJP has released an 'Aarop Patra' (chargesheet) against the AAP government in anticipation of the upcoming Delhi elections. AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal has provided a strong reaction to the claims made by the BJP.

  • BJP highlights alleged failures and corruption of the AAP government.
  • Kejriwal counters with accusations of political mudslinging.
  • The political climate in Delhi is heating up as elections approach.
'We will combat these false accusations with facts and figures,' stated Kejriwal during a press conference.

The upcoming elections promise to be contentious as both parties gear up for a battle of narratives.

item.title: Sunny Leone gets monthly grant under Chhattisgarh govt scheme. But there's a twist - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sunny Leone gets monthly grant under Chhattisgarh govt scheme. But there's a twist

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A man in Chhattisgarh has fraudulently opened an account in the name of actress Sunny Leone to illegally receive monthly government grants designated for women.

  • The Chhattisgarh government provides ₹1,000 every month to married women through the 'Mahtari Vandan Yojana'.
  • Virendra Joshi allegedly opened the account under Sunny Leone's name and has been receiving money illegally.
  • Authorities are investigating the case and have frozen the fraudulent account.
  • The discovery has led to political tensions between the BJP and Congress parties regarding the effectiveness of the scheme.
Deepak Baij of Congress claims that over 50% of beneficiaries of the Mahtari Vandan Yojana are fake.

This incident highlights issues of fraud and portrayal of social welfare programs while raising questions about beneficiary verification processes.

item.title: Law aspirant moves Delhi High Court seeking further revision of CLAT 2025 results - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi High Court Appeal for CLAT 2025 Results Revision

Published on: 23 Dec 2024, 7:17 am

An appeal has been filed before the Delhi High Court seeking further revision of the Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) 2025 results, challenging a recent verdict concerning errors in the questions and answer key.

  • The appeal follows a December 20 ruling that acknowledged errors in two questions.
  • The appellant claims three additional questions also contain mistakes that affect exam integrity.
  • The appeal emphasizes the need for revision for all flagged questions to ensure fairness.
“Since Court has upheld option ‘C’ as the correct answer... benefit cannot be restricted only to the petitioner and will extend to all candidates who have opted for option ‘C’,” - Justice Jyoti Singh

The Division Bench is set to hear the appeal for further consideration.

item.title: 18% GST on caramelised popcorn sparks meme fest online. Best ones here - India Today
item.description:
18% GST on Caramelised Popcorn Sparks Online Meme Fest

Published On: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: India Today

The GST Council’s decision to impose an 18% GST on caramelised popcorn has ignited a wave of memes on social media.

  • Unpacked and unlabelled salted popcorn: 5% GST
  • Pre-packed and labelled ready-to-eat popcorn: 12% GST
  • Caramelised popcorn: 18% GST
One user joked about eating their last packet of caramelised popcorn before the price surges.

The humorous reactions indicate the complexity of tax classifications and the rise of popcorn as a ‘luxury’ item online.

item.title: Steering, Throttle Fault May Be Behind Mumbai Ferry Crash, Crew Knew: Sources - NDTV
item.description:
Steering, Throttle Fault May Be Behind Mumbai Ferry Crash, Crew Knew: Sources

Published on December 18, Source: Mumbai News

The recent collision between a Navy boat and a passenger ferry in Mumbai resulted in tragic losses, likely due to technical issues with the naval vessel.

  • The incident occurred on December 18, resulting in 15 deaths.
  • A technical malfunction in the steering assembly and throttle quadrant is believed to be the cause.
  • The Navy boat was reportedly speeding and lost control before the collision.
  • The ferry was carrying over 100 passengers and sank in the Arabian Sea.
  • Of the 113 people on both vessels, 15 perished, and 98 were rescued.
  • The ferry was overloaded, surpassing its licensed passenger capacity.
  • The Maharashtra Maritime Board has initiated an investigation and cancelled the ferry's license.
“The crew was aware of the malfunction when the collision took place.” - Survivor from the Navy vessel

The tragedy highlights significant safety concerns in maritime operations and calls for a thorough investigation into the events leading to the accident.

item.title: Chandrababu Naidu & Revanth Reddy: A Meeting in Davos? - Gulte
item.description:
Chandrababu Naidu & Revanth Reddy: A Meeting in Davos?

Published on: 12:06 pm, 23 December 2024

The chief ministers of the Telugu states, Chandrababu Naidu and Revanth Reddy, are set to attend the upcoming World Economic Forum Summit in Davos, which begins on January 20. While this may be an opportunity for them to meet, their attendance will be in an individual capacity rather than a bilateral meeting.

  • Both leaders have previously met to discuss post-bifurcation issues.
  • This will be Naidu’s first trip to Davos during his second tenure as a chief minister.
  • Revanth Reddy continues the tradition of attending the summit.
  • Maharashtra's chief minister Devendra Fadnavis will also be at Davos.
“It has to be seen if they will orchestrate a meeting here to discuss political affairs of Telugu states.”

The upcoming summit presents a significant platform for political discussions among the Telugu CMs, which could influence the region's governance.

item.title: 'Sunny Leone' has been receiving Rs 1,000 monthly under the Chhattisgarh's Mahatari Vandan Yojana since M - The Times of India
item.description:
'Sunny Leone' Receives Rs 1,000 Monthly Under Chhattisgarh's Mahatari Vandan Yojana

Published on: March 2024 by Unknown Source

Sunny Leone has been receiving financial support under the Mahatari Vandan Yojana in Chhattisgarh since March 2024, aimed at assisting mothers.

  • The scheme provides a monthly incentive of Rs 1,000.
  • The program aims to empower women and support child wellbeing in the state.
  • Sunny Leone's public persona has influenced the visibility of government initiatives.
"This scheme is a step towards recognizing the importance of mothers in society."

The financial assistance program represents a significant effort by the Chhattisgarh government to support families and enhance women's roles.

item.title: Rozgar Mela | Record govt jobs provided in one-and-a-half years, says PM Modi - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Announces Record Government Jobs at Rozgar Mela

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi distributed over 71,000 appointment letters to newly appointed recruits, claiming his government has provided nearly 10 lakh permanent government jobs in the past year and a half.

  • More than 71,000 appointment letters were distributed through video conferencing.
  • Nearly 10 lakh permanent government jobs have been provided in the last one and a half years.
  • Focus on youth, honesty, and transparency in the recruitment process.
  • Government initiatives include 26-week maternity leave helping women in their careers.
  • Recruitment efforts have seen a significant rise in women and candidates from OBC, SC, and ST categories.
"Rozgar Melas are empowering the youth and unlocking their potential. Best wishes to the newly inducted appointees." — Narendra Modi

The government aims for maximal utilization of Indian youth talents through various development schemes and educational reforms.

item.title: Bengaluru software engineer loses whopping Rs 11.8 crore to ‘digital arrest’ scam - The Indian Express
item.description:
Bengaluru Software Engineer Loses Rs 11.8 Crore to Digital Arrest Scam

Publication Date: December 12, 2024

Source: Local News

A software engineer in Bengaluru fell victim to a digital arrest scam, losing a staggering Rs 11.8 crore in just 18 days, making it one of the largest cybercrimes in the city.

  • The engineer, aged 39, reported the incident to the North-East CEN police after being duped between November 25 and December 12.
  • The scam began with a call from someone impersonating a TRAI officer, alleging misuse of the victim's Aadhaar for illegal activities.
  • Subsequent calls from fraudsters, posing as police officers, threatened the victim with arrest and coerced him into transferring large sums of money for “verification.”
  • Over several transactions, the victim transferred a total of Rs 11.8 crore to accounts controlled by the scammers.
  • The police have launched an investigation under the Information Technology Act along with relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.
  • In 2024 alone, Bengaluru has witnessed losses exceeding Rs 1,806 crore due to cybercrimes, highlighting an alarming trend in the city.
“This marks the highest recovery achieved by the Bengaluru city police in connection with cybercrime.”

In conclusion, this case underscores the growing threat of cybercrime in Bengaluru, with significant financial implications for individuals and ongoing concerns about safety and security in the digital world.

item.title: Bengaluru Volvo SUV crash: How a 'mindless' car driver and an aluminium-laden truck wiped out IT firm CEO - The Times of India
item.description:
Bengaluru Volvo SUV crash: How a 'mindless' car driver and an aluminium-laden truck wiped out IT firm CEO, his family

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

A tragic incident occurred in Bengaluru involving a Volvo SUV, claiming the lives of an IT firm CEO and his family. The crash was attributed to reckless driving by a car and an overweight truck laden with aluminum.

  • The CEO and his family were pronounced dead at the scene following the accident.
  • Witnesses described the events as horrifying, detailing the speed and lack of caution exhibited by the vehicles involved.
  • The incident has sparked discussions regarding road safety and the need for stricter traffic regulations.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the crash and whether any legal actions will be pursued against the negligent drivers.
“This tragedy reminds us of the fragility of life and the importance of safety on the roads,” said a local community leader.

This unfortunate event underlines the urgent need for increased awareness and enforcement of road safety measures to prevent similar accidents in the future.

item.title: Assam Police SI Admit Card 2024 Live: SLPRB admit card released at slprbassam.in, direct link - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Assam Police SI Admit Card 2024 Live Updates

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Assam Police Sub Inspector recruitment admit card has been released today. Candidates can access it through the SLPRB Assam's official website.

  • The written examination is scheduled for January 5, 2025.
  • Candidates must bring the admit card and a government-issued photo ID to the exam.
  • To download the admit card, candidates need to enter their application number, name, and date of birth.
  • SLPRB is conducting recruitment for various Sub Inspector positions.
“Candidates must ensure all details are correct on the admit card and report any discrepancies to the technical support.”

For updates, candidates should regularly check the SLPRB website.

item.title: 3 Marriages, Rs 1.25 Crore: How 'Looteri Dulhan' Targeted Rich Men - NDTV
item.description:
3 Marriages, Rs 1.25 Crore: How 'Looteri Dulhan' Targeted Rich Men

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A woman has been arrested over a decade after marrying a series of men and extracting over ₹ 1.25 crore from them under the pretext of settlements.

  • Seema, also known as Nikki, first married a businessman from Agra in 2013 and received ₹ 75 lakh after filing a case against his family.
  • In 2017, she married a software engineer from Gurugram, taking an additional ₹ 10 lakh after their separation.
  • Her latest marriage was to a businessman from Jaipur in 2023, from whom she fled with cash and jewellery worth ₹ 36 lakh.
“Police investigation revealed that Seema sought her victims on matrimonial sites, focusing on men who were divorced or widowed.”

This case highlights the alarming trend of individuals exploiting matrimonial platforms for financial gain.
